section.title: Feature Toggles
section.paragraph: This is the list of all Open edX feature toggles used in edx-platform. These feature toggles can be used to enable or disable features manually on every platform.

section.title: ALLOW_HIDING_DISCUSSION_TAB
section.paragraph: Desc: If True, it adds an option to show/hide the discussions tab.

section.title: ALLOW_PUBLIC_ACCOUNT_CREATION
section.paragraph: Desc: Allow public account creation. If this is disabled, users will no longer have access to the signup page.

section.title: ANONYMOUS_SURVEY_REPORT
section.paragraph: Desc: If enable, the survey report will be send a UUID as ID instead of use lms site name.

section.title: AUTOMATIC_AUTH_FOR_TESTING
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to perform acceptance and load test. Auto auth view is responsible for load testing and is controlled by this feature flag. Session verification (of CacheBackedAuthenticationMiddleware) is a security feature, but it can be turned off by enabling this feature flag.

warning.paragraph: If this has been set to True then the account activation email will be skipped.

section.title: BADGES_ENABLED
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable badges functionality.

section.title: BULK_EMAIL_SEND_USING_EDX_ACE
section.paragraph: Desc: If True, use edx-ace to send bulk email messages

section.title: CERTIFICATES_HTML_VIEW
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable course certificates on your instance of Open edX.

warning.paragraph: You must enable this feature flag in both Studio and the LMS and complete the configuration tasks described here: https://docs.openedx.org/en/latest/site_ops/install_configure_run_guide/configuration/enable_certificates.html pylint: disable=line-too-long,useless-suppression

section.title: COURSES_INVITE_ONLY
section.paragraph: Desc: Setting this sets the default value of INVITE_ONLY across all courses in a given deployment

section.title: CUSTOM_COURSES_EDX
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable Custom Courses for edX, a feature that is more commonly known as CCX. Documentation for configuring and using this feature is available at https://docs.openedx.org/en/latest/site_ops/install_configure_run_guide/configuration/enable_ccx.html

warning.paragraph: When set to true, ‘lms.djangoapps.ccx.overrides.CustomCoursesForEdxOverrideProvider’ will be added to MODULESTORE_FIELD_OVERRIDE_PROVIDERS

section.title: CourseDurationLimitConfig.enabled
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, users will have a limited time to complete and audit the course. The exact duration is given by the “weeks_to_complete” course detail. When enabled, it is necessary to also define the “enabled_as_of” flag: only enrollments created after this date will be affected.

section.title: CourseHLSPlaybackEnabledFlag.course_id
section.paragraph: Desc: Add the “hls” profile to all displayed videos for a single course.

section.title: CourseVideoUploadsEnabledByDefault.course_id
section.paragraph: Desc: Allow video uploads for a specific course. This enables the “Video Uploads” menu in the CMS.

section.title: DEFAULT_MOBILE_AVAILABLE
section.paragraph: Desc: This specifies if the courses are available for mobile by default. To make any individual course available for mobile one can set the value of Mobile Course Available to true in Advanced Settings from the studio when this is False.

section.title: DISABLE_DEPRECATED_SIGNIN_URL
section.paragraph: Desc: Toggle for removing the deprecated /signin url.

warning.paragraph: This url can be removed once it no longer has any real traffic.

section.title: DISABLE_DEPRECATED_SIGNUP_URL
section.paragraph: Desc: Toggle for removing the deprecated /signup url.

warning.paragraph: This url can be removed once it no longer has any real traffic.

section.title: DISABLE_JWT_FOR_MOBILE
section.paragraph: Desc: Set toggle to True to ignore mobile requests for JWTs, and instead provide the legacy opaque Bearer token. This toggle can be used as a temporary kill switch as the mobile app attempts to rollout the transition to JWT authentication for the first time.

section.title: DISABLE_START_DATES
section.paragraph: Desc: When True, all courses will be active, regardless of start date.

warning.paragraph: This will cause ALL courses to be immediately visible.

section.title: DISABLE_UNENROLLMENT
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to disable self-unenrollments via REST API. This also hides the “Unenroll” button on the Learner Dashboard.

warning.paragraph: For consistency in user experience, keep the value in sync with the setting of the same name in the LMS and CMS.

section.title: EDX_DRF_EXTENSIONS[ENABLE_JWT_AND_LMS_USER_EMAIL_MATCH]
section.paragraph: Desc: Toggle to add a check for matching user email in JWT and LMS user email for authentication in JwtAuthentication class. This toggle should only be enabled in the LMS as our identity service that is also creating the JWTs.

section.title: EDX_DRF_EXTENSIONS[ENABLE_SET_REQUEST_USER_FOR_JWT_COOKIE]
section.paragraph: Desc: Toggle for setting request.user with jwt cookie authentication. This makes the JWT cookie user available to middleware while processing the request, if the session user wasn’t already available. This requires JwtAuthCookieMiddleware to work.

warning.paragraph: This feature caused a memory leak in edx-platform. This toggle is temporary only if we can make it work in all services, or find a replacement. Consider making this a permanent toggle instead.

section.title: EMBARGO
section.paragraph: Desc: Turns on embargo functionality, which blocks users from the site or courses based on their location. Embargo can restrict users by states and whitelist/blacklist (IP Addresses (ie. 10.0.0.0), Networks (ie. 10.0.0.0/24)), or the user profile country.

warning.paragraph: reverse proxy should be configured appropriately for example Client IP address headers (e.g HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR) should be configured.

section.title: ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, this toggle prevents the use of known-vulnerable passwords in the login flow if their frequency exceeds a threshold. Passwords are assessed by calling the Pwned Passwords service using a k-anonymity method that does not expose the password. The service tells us whether the password has been seen in any data breaches, and if so, how often. This count is converted to a “frequency” by taking the logarithm base 10. The login flow can reject all vulnerable passwords, or only passwords with a frequency above a configured threshold. In existing deployments, the threshold should be set high and tightened gradually in order to avoid large spikes in password resets and support requests. For example, setting ``HIBP_LOGIN_BLOCK_PASSWORD_FREQUENCY_THRESHOLD`` to 5 would reject logins when the password has been seen 100,000 or more times in the Pwned Passwords dataset. The goal should be to gradually reduce this to 0, meaning even a single occurrence will cause a rejection. (The threshold can take any real-number value.)

section.title: ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, the login flow detects vulnerable passwords and prompts users to change their password if their frequency exceeds a threshold. See ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY for more details.

section.title: ENABLE_AUTHN_REGISTER_HIBP_POLICY
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, this toggle prevents the use of known-vulnerable passwords in the registration flow if their frequency exceeds a threshold. See ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY for more details.

section.title: ENABLE_AUTHN_RESET_PASSWORD_HIBP_POLICY
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, this toggle prevents the use of known-vulnerable passwords in the password reset flow. See ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY for more details.

section.title: ENABLE_AUTO_GENERATED_USERNAME
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable auto-generation of usernames.

warning.paragraph: Changing this setting may affect user authentication, account management and discussions experience.

section.title: ENABLE_CHANGE_USER_PASSWORD_ADMIN
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable changing a user password through django admin. This is disabled by default because enabling allows a method to bypass password policy.

section.title: ENABLE_CODEJAIL_DARKLAUNCH
section.paragraph: Desc: Turn on to send requests to both the codejail service and the installed codejail library for testing and evaluation purposes. The results from the installed codejail library will be the ones used.

warning.paragraph: This toggle will only behave as expected when ENABLE_CODEJAIL_REST_SERVICE is not enabled and when CODE_JAIL_REST_SERVICE_REMOTE_EXEC, CODE_JAIL_REST_SERVICE_HOST, CODE_JAIL_REST_SERVICE_READ_TIMEOUT, and CODE_JAIL_REST_SERVICE_CONNECT_TIMEOUT are configured.

section.title: ENABLE_CODEJAIL_REST_SERVICE
section.paragraph: Desc: Set this to True if you want to run Codejail code using a separate VM or container and communicate with edx-platform using REST API.

section.title: ENABLE_COMPREHENSIVE_THEMING
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, this toggle activates the use of the custom theme defined by DEFAULT_SITE_THEME.

section.title: ENABLE_COPPA_COMPLIANCE
section.paragraph: Desc: When True, enforces COPPA compliance and removes YOB field from registration form and account

section.title: ENABLE_CREDIT_ELIGIBILITY
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, it is possible to define a credit eligibility criteria in the CMS. A “Credit Eligibility” section then appears for those courses in the LMS.

section.title: ENABLE_CSMH_EXTENDED
section.paragraph: Desc: Write Courseware Student Module History (CSMH) to the extended table: this logs all student activities to MySQL, in a separate database.

warning.paragraph: Even though most Open edX instances run with a separate CSMH database, it may not always be the case. When disabling this feature flag, remember to remove “lms.djangoapps.coursewarehistoryextended” from the INSTALLED_APPS and the “StudentModuleHistoryExtendedRouter” from the DATABASE_ROUTERS. This is needed in the LMS and CMS for migration consistency.

section.title: ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE
section.paragraph: Desc: When True, it will enable the Discussion tab in courseware for all courses. Setting this to False will not contain inline discussion components and discussion tab in any courses.

warning.paragraph: If the discussion panel is present in the course and the value for this flag is False then, attempting to expand those components will cause errors. So, this should only be set to False with an LMS that is running courses that do not contain discussion components. For consistency in user-experience, keep the value in sync with the setting of the same name in the CMS.

section.title: ENABLE_DYNAMIC_REGISTRATION_FIELDS
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, this toggle adds fields configured in

section.title: ENABLE_GRADING_METHOD_IN_PROBLEMS
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the grading method feature in capa problems.

section.title: ENABLE_HELP_LINK
section.paragraph: Desc: When True, a help link is displayed on the main navbar. Set False to hide it.

section.title: ENABLE_INTEGRITY_SIGNATURE
section.paragraph: Desc: Whether to display honor code agreement for learners before their first grade assignment.

section.title: ENABLE_LTI_PII_ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the lti pii acknowledgement feature for a course

section.title: ENABLE_MFE_CONFIG_API
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable MFE Config API. This is disabled by default.

section.title: ENABLE_MKTG_SITE
section.paragraph: Desc: Toggle to enable alternate urls for marketing links.

warning.paragraph: When this is enabled, the MKTG_URLS setting should be defined. The use case of this feature toggle is uncertain.

section.title: ENABLE_OAUTH2_PROVIDER
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable this feature to allow this Open edX platform to be an OAuth2 authentication provider. This is necessary to enable some other features, such as the REST API for the mobile application.

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: ENABLE_ORA_ALL_FILE_URLS
section.paragraph: Desc: A “work-around” feature toggle meant to help in cases where some file uploads are not discoverable. If enabled, will iterate through all possible file key suffixes up to the max for displaying file metadata in staff assessments.

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: ENABLE_ORA_USER_STATE_UPLOAD_DATA
section.paragraph: Desc: A “work-around” feature toggle meant to help in cases where some file uploads are not discoverable. If enabled, will pull file metadata from StudentModule.state for display in staff assessments.

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: ENABLE_PASSWORD_RESET_FAILURE_EMAIL
section.paragraph: Desc: Whether to send an email for failed password reset attempts or not. This happens when a user asks for a password reset but they don’t have an account associated to their email. This is useful for notifying users that they don’t have an account associated with email addresses they believe they’ve registered with. This setting can be overridden by a site-specific configuration.

section.title: ENABLE_REQUIRE_THIRD_PARTY_AUTH
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to prevent using username/password login and registration and only allow authentication with third party auth

warning.paragraph: Requires configuration of third party auth

section.title: ENABLE_SAML_CONFIG_SIGNAL_HANDLERS
section.paragraph: Desc: Controls whether SAML configuration signal handlers are active. When enabled (True), signal handlers will automatically update SAMLProviderConfig references when the associated SAMLConfiguration is updated. When disabled (False), SAMLProviderConfigs point to outdated SAMLConfiguration.

warning.paragraph: Disabling this toggle may result in SAMLProviderConfig instances pointing to outdated SAMLConfiguration records. Use the management command ‘saml –fix-references’ to fix outdated references.

section.title: ENABLE_SPECIAL_EXAMS
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable to use special exams, aka timed and proctored exams.

section.title: ENABLE_TEXTBOOK
section.paragraph: Desc: Add PDF and HTML textbook tabs to the courseware.

warning.paragraph: For consistency in user-experience, keep the value in sync with the setting of the same name in the CMS.

section.title: ENFORCE_SAFE_SESSIONS
section.paragraph: Desc: Invalidate session and response if mismatch detected. That is, when the `user` attribute of the request object gets changed or no longer matches the session, the session will be invalidated and the response cancelled (changed to an error). This is intended as a backup safety measure in case an attacker (or bug) is able to change the user on a session in an unexpected way.

warning.paragraph: Should be disabled if debugging mismatches using the LOG_REQUEST_USER_CHANGE_HEADERS toggle, otherwise series of mismatching requests from the same user cannot be investigated. Additionally, if enabling for the first time, confirm that incidences of the string “SafeCookieData user at request” in the logs are very rare; if they are not, it is likely that there is either a bug or that a login or registration endpoint needs to call ``mark_user_change_as_expected``.

section.title: ENFORCE_SESSION_EMAIL_MATCH
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, this setting invalidates sessions in other browsers upon email change, while preserving the session validity in the browser where the email change occurs. This toggle is just being used for rollout.

section.title: EVENT_BUS_KAFKA_AUDIT_LOGGING_ENABLED
section.paragraph: Desc: If True, whenever an event is produced or consumed, log enough information to uniquely identify it for debugging purposes. This will not include all the data on the event, but at a minimum will include topic, partition, offset, message ID, and key. Deployers may wish to disable this if log volume is excessive.

section.title: EVENT_BUS_KAFKA_CONSUMERS_ENABLED
section.paragraph: Desc: If set to False, consumer will exit immediately. This can be used as an emergency kill-switch to disable a consumer—as long as the management command is killed and restarted when settings change.

section.title: EVENT_BUS_PRODUCER_CONFIG[‘org.openedx.content_authoring.course.catalog_info.changed.v1’] [‘course-catalog-info-changed’][‘enabled’]
section.paragraph: Desc: if enabled, will publish COURSE_CATALOG_INFO_CHANGED events to the event bus on the course-catalog-info-changed topics

warning.paragraph: The default may be changed in a later release. See https://github.com/openedx/openedx-events/issues/265

section.title: EVENT_BUS_PRODUCER_CONFIG[‘org.openedx.learning.course.unenrollment.completed.v1’] [‘course-unenrollment-lifecycle’][‘enabled’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables sending COURSE_UNENROLLMENT_COMPLETED events over the event bus.

warning.paragraph: The default may be changed in a later release. See https://github.com/openedx/openedx-events/issues/265

section.title: EVENT_BUS_PRODUCER_CONFIG[‘org.openedx.learning.xblock.skill.verified.v1’] [‘learning-xblock-skill-verified’][‘enabled’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables sending xblock_skill_verified events over the event bus.

warning.paragraph: The default may be changed in a later release. See https://github.com/openedx/openedx-events/issues/265

section.title: EVENT_BUS_REDIS_AUDIT_LOGGING_ENABLED
section.paragraph: Desc: If True, whenever an event is produced or consumed, log enough information to uniquely identify it for debugging purposes. This will not include all the data on the event, but at a minimum will include topic, partition, offset, message ID, and key. Deployers may wish to disable this if log volume is excessive.

section.title: EVENT_BUS_REDIS_CONSUMERS_ENABLED
section.paragraph: Desc: If set to False, consumer will exit immediately. This can be used as an emergency kill-switch to disable a consumer—as long as the management command is killed and restarted when settings change.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ALLOW_AUTOMATED_SIGNUPS’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable to show a section in the membership tab of the instructor dashboard to allow an upload of a CSV file that contains a list of new accounts to create and register for course.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ALLOW_COURSE_STAFF_GRADE_DOWNLOADS’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable to give course staff unrestricted access to grade downloads; if set to False, only edX superusers can perform the downloads.

section.title: FEATURES[‘BATCH_ENROLLMENT_NOTIFY_USERS_DEFAULT’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Controls if the “Notify users by email” checkbox in the batch enrollment form on the instructor dashboard is already checked on page load or not.

section.title: FEATURES[‘CERTIFICATES_INSTRUCTOR_GENERATION’] # lint-amnesty, pylint: disable=annotation-missing-token
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable to allow batch generation of certificates from the instructor dashboard. In case of self-paced courses, the certificate generation button is hidden if certificate generation is not explicitly enabled globally or for the specific course.

section.title: FEATURES[‘CREATE_COURSE_WITH_DEFAULT_ENROLLMENT_START_DATE’]
section.paragraph: Desc: The default behavior, when this is disabled, is that a newly created course has no enrollment_start date set. When the feature is enabled - the newly created courses will have the enrollment_start_date set to DEFAULT_START_DATE. This is intended to be a permanent option. This toggle affects the course listing pages (platform’s index page, /courses page) when course search is performed using the `lms.djangoapp.branding.get_visible_courses` method and the COURSE_CATALOG_VISIBILITY_PERMISSION setting is set to ‘see_exists’. Switching the toggle to True will prevent the newly created (empty) course from appearing in the course listing.

section.title: FEATURES[‘DISPLAY_ANALYTICS_ENROLLMENTS’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable display of enrollment counts in instructor dashboard and analytics section.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_AUTOMATED_SIGNUPS_EXTRA_FIELDS’]
section.paragraph: Desc: When True, the CSV file that contains a list of new accounts to create and register for a course in the membership tab of the instructor dashboard will accept the cohort name to assign the new user and the enrollment course mode.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_CCX_ANALYTICS_DASHBOARD_URL’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Display the ‘Analytics’ tab in the instructor dashboard for CCX courses. Note: This has no effect unless ANALYTICS_DASHBOARD_URL is already set, because without that setting, the tab does not show up for any courses.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_CERTIFICATES_INSTRUCTOR_MANAGE] # lint-amnesty, pylint: disable=annotation-missing-token
section.paragraph: Desc: Allow course instructors to manage certificates from the instructor dashboard.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables use of the legacy and v2 libraries waffle flags. Note that legacy content libraries are only supported in courses using split mongo.

warning.paragraph: This flag is deprecated in Sumac, and will be removed in favor of the disable_legacy_libraries and disable_new_libraries waffle flags.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_ENHANCED_STAFF_GRADER’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable the enhanced staff grader feature

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_EXPORT_GIT’]
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, a “Export to Git” menu item is added to the course studio for courses that have a valid “giturl” attribute. Exporting a course to git causes the course to be exported in the directory indicated by the GIT_REPO_EXPORT_DIR setting. Note that when this feature is disabled, courses can still be exported to git with the git_export management command.

warning.paragraph: To enable this feature, the GIT_REPO_EXPORT_DIR setting must be properly defined and point to an existing directory.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_FORUM_DAILY_DIGEST’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Settings for forums/discussions to on/off daily digest feature. Set this to True if you want to enable users to subscribe and unsubscribe for daily digest. This setting enables deprecation of daily digest.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_GRADE_DOWNLOADS’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable grade CSV downloads from the instructor dashboard. Grade calculation started from the instructor dashboard will write grades CSV files to the configured storage backend and give links for downloads.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_LEARNER_RECORDS’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable learner records for the whole platform. This setting may be overridden by site- and org-specific site configurations with the same name.

warning.paragraph: Enabling this feature requires that the definition of the ``CREDENTIALS_PUBLIC_SERVICE_URL`` setting.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_ORA_MOBILE_SUPPORT’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable the ORA2 Xblock to be rendered in mobile apps.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_ORA_PEER_CONFIGURABLE_GRADING’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable configurable grading for peer review.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_ORA_RUBRIC_REUSE’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable the reuse of rubric feature

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_ORA_SELECTABLE_LEARNER_WAITING_REVIEW’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable selectable learner in the waiting step list ORA2. When enabled, it shows a checkbox to select a learner, and when a learner is chosen, it shows a review button to see the details of a submission.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENABLE_ORA_TEAM_SUBMISSIONS’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable team-based ORA submissions.

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date. This can be overridden by a course waffle flags or a waffle switch with identical name.

section.title: FEATURES[‘ENTRANCE_EXAMS’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable entrance exams feature. When enabled, students see an exam xblock as the first unit of the course.

section.title: FEATURES[‘MILESTONES_APP’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable the milestones application, which manages significant Course and/or Student events in the Open edX platform. (see https://github.com/openedx/edx-milestones) Note that this feature is required to enable course pre-requisites.

section.title: FEATURES[‘SHOW_PROGRESS_BAR’]
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to show progress bar.

section.title: GLOBAL_NOTICE_ENABLED
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, show the contents of GLOBAL_NOTICE_MESSAGE as a message on every page. This is intended to be used as a way of communicating an upcoming or currently active maintenance window or to warn of known site issues. HTML is not supported for the message content, only plaintext. Message styling can be controlled with GLOBAL_NOTICE_TYPE, set to one of INFO, SUCCESS, WARNING, or ERROR (defaulting to INFO). Also see openedx.core.djangoapps.util.maintenance_banner.add_maintenance_banner for a variation that only shows a message on specific views.

section.title: HLSPlaybackEnabledFlag.enabled_for_all_courses
section.paragraph: Desc: Add the “hls” profile to all displayed videos on the platform.

section.title: IGNORED_ERRORS[N][‘LOG_ERROR’]
section.paragraph: Desc: If True, the error will be logged with a message like: “Ignored error …”.

section.title: IGNORED_ERRORS[N][‘LOG_STACK_TRACE’]
section.paragraph: Desc: If True, the stacktrace will be included with the logging message.

warning.paragraph: Requires ``LOG_ERROR`` to be set to True, otherwise this value will be ignored.

section.title: JWT_AUTH_ADD_KID_HEADER
section.paragraph: Desc: When True, add KID header to JWT using asymmetrical key.

section.title: JWT_AUTH_FORCE_CREATE_ASYMMETRIC
section.paragraph: Desc: When True, forces the LMS to only create JWTs signed with the asymmetric key. This is a temporary rollout toggle for DEPR of symmetric JWTs.

section.title: LICENSING
section.paragraph: Desc: Toggle platform-wide course licensing. The course.license attribute is then used to append license information to the courseware.

section.title: LOG_REQUEST_USER_CHANGES
section.paragraph: Desc: Turn this toggle on to provide additional debugging information in the case of a user verification error. It will track anytime the `user` attribute of a request object is changed and store this information on the request. This will also track the location where the change is coming from to quickly find issues. If user verification fails at response time, all of the information about these changes will be logged.

warning.paragraph: Adds some processing overhead to all requests to gather debug info. Will also double the logging for failed verification checks.

section.title: LOG_REQUEST_USER_CHANGE_HEADERS
section.paragraph: Desc: Turn this toggle on to log all request headers, for all requests, for all user ids involved in any user id change detected by safe sessions. The headers will provide additional debugging information. The headers will be logged for all requests up until LOG_REQUEST_USER_CHANGE_HEADERS_DURATION seconds after the time of the last mismatch. The header details will be encrypted, and only available with the private key.

warning.paragraph: Logging headers of subsequent requests following a mismatch will only work if LOG_REQUEST_USER_CHANGES is enabled and ENFORCE_SAFE_SESSIONS is disabled; otherwise, only headers of the inital mismatch will be logged. Also, SAFE_SESSIONS_DEBUG_PUBLIC_KEY must be set. See https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/master/common/djangoapps/util/log_sensitive.py for instructions.

section.title: MARK_LIBRARY_CONTENT_BLOCK_COMPLETE_ON_VIEW
section.paragraph: Desc: If enabled, the Library Content Block is marked as complete when users view it. Otherwise (by default), all children of this block must be completed.

warning.paragraph: For consistency in user-experience, keep the value in sync between the LMS and CMS

section.title: ORGANIZATIONS_AUTOCREATE
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, creating a course run or content library with an “org slug” that does not map to an Organization in the database will trigger the creation of a new Organization, with its name and short_name set to said org slug. When disabled, creation of such content with an unknown org slug will instead result in a validation error. If you want the Organization table to be an authoritative information source in Studio, then disable this; however, if you want the table to just be a reflection of the orgs referenced in Studio content, then leave it enabled.

section.title: RATELIMIT_ENABLE
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, RATELIMIT_RATE is applied. When disabled, RATELIMIT_RATE is not applied.

section.title: RBAC_IGNORE_INVALID_JWT_COOKIE
section.paragraph: Desc: When true, causes instances of `jwt.exceptions.InvalidTokenError` to be ignored instead of raised in the `get_decoded_jwt()` utility function. Defaults to False for backward-compatibility purposes, but it’s recommended to be set to True in dependent applications.

section.title: RESTRICT_AUTOMATIC_AUTH
section.paragraph: Desc: Prevent auto auth from creating superusers or modifying existing users. Auto auth is a mechanism where superusers can simply modify attributes of other users by accessing the “/auto_auth url” with the right querystring parameters.

section.title: SEARCH_SKIP_INVITATION_ONLY_FILTERING
section.paragraph: Desc: If enabled, invitation-only courses will appear in search results.

section.title: SEARCH_SKIP_SHOW_IN_CATALOG_FILTERING
section.paragraph: Desc: If enabled, courses with a catalog_visibility set to “none” will still appear in search results.

section.title: SEND_TRACKING_EVENT_EMITTED_SIGNAL
section.paragraph: Desc: When True, the system will publish `TRACKING_EVENT_EMITTED` signals to the event bus. The `TRACKING_EVENT_EMITTED` signal is emit when a tracking log is emitted.

section.title: SHOW_FOOTER_LANGUAGE_SELECTOR
section.paragraph: Desc: When set to True, language selector will be visible in the footer.

warning.paragraph: LANGUAGE_COOKIE_NAME is required to use footer-language-selector, set it if it has not been set.

section.title: SHOW_HEADER_LANGUAGE_SELECTOR
section.paragraph: Desc: When set to True, language selector will be visible in the header.

warning.paragraph: You should set the languages in the DarkLangConfig table to get this working. If you have not set any languages in the DarkLangConfig table then the language selector will not be visible in the header.

section.title: SHOW_REGISTRATION_LINKS
section.paragraph: Desc: Allow registration links. If this is disabled, users will no longer see buttons to the the signup page.

section.title: SOME_FEATURE_NAME
section.paragraph: Desc: Flag would be used to show account activation popup after the registration

section.title: SURVEY_REPORT_ENABLE
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable the feature to generate and send survey reports.

section.title: TPA_AUTOMATIC_LOGOUT_ENABLED
section.paragraph: Desc: Redirect the user to the TPA logout URL if this flag is enabled, the TPA logout URL is configured, and the user logs in through TPA.

warning.paragraph: Enabling this toggle skips rendering logout.html, which is used to log the user out from the different IDAs. To ensure the user is logged out of all the IDAs be sure to redirect back to <LMS>/logout after logging out of the TPA.

section.title: USE_EXTRACTED_ANNOTATABLE_BLOCK
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the use of the extracted annotatable XBlock, which has been shifted to the ‘openedx/xblocks-contrib’ repo.

warning.paragraph: Not production-ready until https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/issues/34841 is done.

section.title: USE_EXTRACTED_DISCUSSION_BLOCK
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the use of the extracted Discussion XBlock, which has been shifted to the ‘openedx/xblocks-contrib’ repo.

warning.paragraph: Not production-ready until relevant subtask https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/issues/34827 is done.

section.title: USE_EXTRACTED_HTML_BLOCK
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the use of the extracted HTML XBlock, which has been shifted to the ‘openedx/xblocks-contrib’ repo.

warning.paragraph: Not production-ready until relevant subtask https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/issues/34827 is done.

section.title: USE_EXTRACTED_LTI_BLOCK
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the use of the extracted LTI XBlock, which has been shifted to the ‘openedx/xblocks-contrib’ repo.

warning.paragraph: Not production-ready until relevant subtask https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/issues/34827 is done.

section.title: USE_EXTRACTED_POLL_QUESTION_BLOCK
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the use of the extracted poll question XBlock, which has been shifted to the ‘openedx/xblocks-contrib’ repo.

warning.paragraph: Not production-ready until https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/issues/34839 is done.

section.title: USE_EXTRACTED_PROBLEM_BLOCK
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the use of the extracted Problem XBlock, which has been shifted to the ‘openedx/xblocks-contrib’ repo.

warning.paragraph: Not production-ready until relevant subtask https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/issues/34827 is done.

section.title: USE_EXTRACTED_VIDEO_BLOCK
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the use of the extracted Video XBlock, which has been shifted to the ‘openedx/xblocks-contrib’ repo.

warning.paragraph: Not production-ready until relevant subtask https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/issues/34827 is done.

section.title: USE_EXTRACTED_WORD_CLOUD_BLOCK
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the use of the extracted Word Cloud XBlock, which has been shifted to the ‘openedx/xblocks-contrib’ repo.

warning.paragraph: Not production-ready until https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/issues/34840 is done.

section.title: VEMPipelineIntegration.enabled
section.paragraph: Desc: Send videos to the Video Encode Manager (VEM) as part of the video pipeline.

section.title: VideoUploadsEnabledByDefault.enabled_for_all_courses
section.paragraph: Desc: Allow video uploads for all courses of the platform. This enables the “Video Uploads” menu in the CMS.

section.title: WIKI_ACCOUNT_HANDLING
section.paragraph: Desc: We recommend you leave this as ‘False’ for an Open edX installation to get the proper behavior for register, login and logout. For the original docs see: https://github.com/openedx/django-wiki/blob/edx_release/wiki/conf/settings.py

section.title: WIKI_ANONYMOUS
section.paragraph: Desc: Enabling this allows access to anonymous users. For the original docs, see: https://github.com/openedx/django-wiki/blob/edx_release/wiki/conf/settings.py

warning.paragraph: Setting allow anonymous access to `True` may have styling issues.

section.title: WIKI_ENABLED
section.paragraph: Desc: This setting allows us to have a collaborative tool to contribute or modify content of course related materials.

section.title: WIKI_LINK_LIVE_LOOKUPS
section.paragraph: Desc: This setting is defined in the original docs: https://github.com/openedx/django-wiki/blob/edx_release/wiki/conf/settings.py

section.title: WIKI_USE_BOOTSTRAP_SELECT_WIDGET
section.paragraph: Desc: Enabling this will use the bootstrap select widget. For the original docs, see: https://github.com/openedx/django-wiki/blob/edx_release/wiki/conf/settings.py

section.title: agreements.enable_lti_pii_acknowledgement
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the lti pii acknowledgement feature for a course

section.title: bulk_email.EMAIL_USE_COURSE_ID_FROM_FOR_BULK
section.paragraph: Desc: If False, use the same BULK_EMAIL_DEFAULT_FROM_EMAIL or DEFAULT_FROM_EMAIL as the from_addr for all bulk email, to avoid issues with spam filtering

section.title: certificates.auto_certificate_generation
section.paragraph: Desc: This toggle will enable certificates to be automatically generated

section.title: completion.enable_completion_tracking
section.paragraph: Desc: Indicates whether or not to track completion of individual blocks. Keeping this disabled will prevent creation of BlockCompletion objects in the database, as well as preventing completion-related network access by certain xblocks.

section.title: content_tagging.auto
section.paragraph: Desc: Setting this enables automatic tagging of content

section.title: content_tagging.disabled
section.paragraph: Desc: Setting this disables the tagging feature

section.title: contentstore.bypass_olx_failure
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables bypassing olx validation failures during course import.

section.title: contentstore.default_enable_flexible_peer_openassessments
section.paragraph: Desc: This flag turns on the force_on_flexible_peer_openassessments setting for course reruns or new courses, where enabled.

section.title: contentstore.enable_course_optimizer
section.paragraph: Desc: This flag enables the course optimizer tool in the authoring MFE.

section.title: contentstore.enable_course_optimizer_check_prev_run_links
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, allows the Course Optimizer to detect and update links pointing to previous course runs. This feature enables instructors to fix internal course links that still point to old course runs after creating a course rerun.

section.title: contentstore.individualize_anonymous_user_id
section.paragraph: Desc: This flag enables the use of unique anonymous_user_id during studio preview

section.title: contentstore.mock_video_uploads
section.paragraph: Desc: This flag mocks contentstore video uploads for local development, if you don’t have access to AWS

section.title: contentstore.new_studio_mfe.disable_legacy_libraries
section.paragraph: Desc: Hides legacy (v1) Libraries tab in Authoring MFE. This toggle interacts with ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES toggle: if this is disabled, then legacy libraries are also disabled.

warning.paragraph: Legacy libraries are deprecated in Sumac, cf https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/issues/32457

section.title: contentstore.new_studio_mfe.disable_new_libraries
section.paragraph: Desc: Hides new Libraries v2 tab in Authoring MFE. This toggle interacts with settings.MEILISEARCH_ENABLED and ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES toggle: if these flags are False, then v2 libraries are also disabled.

warning.paragraph: Libraries v2 are in beta for Sumac, will be fully supported in Teak.

section.title: contentstore.new_studio_mfe.use_new_video_uploads_page
section.paragraph: Desc: This flag enables the use of the new studio video uploads page mfe

section.title: contentstore.split_library_on_studio_dashboard
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables data new view for library on studio dashboard.

section.title: contentstore.use_react_markdown_editor
section.paragraph: Desc: This flag enables the use of the Markdown editor when creating or editing problems in the authoring MFE

section.title: course_assets.allow_download_code_library
section.paragraph: Desc: Whether to allow learners to download the course code library that is used for custom Python-graded problem blocks. (This is conventionally ``python_lib.zip``, but configurable with Django setting ``PYTHON_LIB_FILENAME``). This file may contain custom grading code or problem answers that should not be revealed to learners.

warning.paragraph: This flag is only intended as a temporary override for use in rollout, to be removed before Ulmo. Courses that rely on learners being able to download the code library should find an alternative workflow, or the toggle should be re-documented as permanent.

section.title: course_blocks_api.hide_access_denials
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to hide access denial messages in the course blocks.

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: course_experience.calendar_sync
section.paragraph: Desc: This course flag enables a course tool (which is a tool that is added on a course home page) that sends course assignment calendars to course students, whenever they click on the “Subscribe to calendar updates” button. The email contains an ics attachment that students can then use to sync with their own calendar apps.

warning.paragraph: For this toggle to have an effect, the RELATIVE_DATES_FLAG toggle must be enabled, too.

section.title: course_experience.enable_about_sidebar_html
section.paragraph: Desc: Used to determine whether to show custom HTML in the sidebar on the internal course about page.

section.title: course_experience.enable_course_goals
section.paragraph: Desc: Used to determine whether or not to use course goals for the particular course.

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: course_experience.enable_ses_for_goalreminder
section.paragraph: Desc: Used to determine whether or not to use AWS SES to send goal reminder emails for the course.

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: course_experience.relative_dates
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to enable relative dates for course content. A ‘Dates’ tab will be visible in the course view showing key course dates. Was previously an ExperimentWaffleFlag with experiment_id=17.

warning.paragraph: To set a relative due date for self-paced courses, the weeks_to_complete field for a course run needs to be set. Currently it can be set through the publisher app.

section.title: course_experience.relative_dates_disable_reset
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to disable resetting deadlines by learners in self-paced courses. The ‘Dates’ tab will no longer show a banner about missed deadlines. The deadlines banner will also be hidden on unit pages.

warning.paragraph: For this toggle to have an effect, the RELATIVE_DATES_FLAG toggle must be enabled, too.

section.title: course_home.course_home_mfe_progress_tab
section.paragraph: Desc: This toggle controls the user interface behavior of the progress tab in the Learning Management System. When set to True, the progress tab utilizes the newly introduced Learning MFE graphs. When set to False (default), it utilizes existing grade graph from edx-platform.

section.title: course_home.new_discussion_sidebar_view
section.paragraph: Desc: This toggle controls the user interface behavior of the discussion sidebar on course home page.

section.title: course_home.send_course_progress_analytics_for_student
section.paragraph: Desc: This toggle controls whether the system will enqueue a Celery task responsible for emitting an analytics events describing how much course content a learner has completed in a course.

section.title: course_list_api_rate_limit.rate_limit_10
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle switch to enable the throttling of 10 requests/minute to the course API. For staff users, this limit is 20 requests/minute.

section.title: course_list_api_rate_limit.rate_limit_2
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle switch to enable the throttling of 2 requests/minute to the course API. For staff users, this limit is 10 requests/minute.

section.title: courseware.always_open_auxiliary_sidebar
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag that determines whether the auxiliary sidebar, such as discussion or notification, should automatically expand on each course unit page within the Learning MFE, without preserving the previous state of the sidebar.

section.title: courseware.disable_navigation_sidebar_blocks_caching
section.paragraph: Desc: Disable caching of navigation sidebar blocks on Learning MFE. It can be used when caching the structure of large courses for a large number of users at the same time can overload the cache storage (memcache or redis).

warning.paragraph: None.

section.title: courseware.discovery_default_language_filter
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable courses to be filtered by user language by default.

warning.paragraph: The ENABLE_COURSE_DISCOVERY feature flag should be enabled.

section.title: courseware.enable_navigation_sidebar
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable navigation sidebar on Learning MFE

section.title: courseware.enable_new_financial_assistance_flow
section.paragraph: Desc: enables new internal only financial assistance flow, when active.

section.title: courseware.mfe_courseware_search
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables Courseware Search on Learning MFE

warning.paragraph: None.

section.title: courseware.mfe_progress_milestones
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to display learner progress milestones in a course. Supports staged rollout to students for a new micro-frontend-based implementation of the courseware page.

warning.paragraph: Also set settings.LEARNING_MICROFRONTEND_URL.

section.title: courseware.mfe_progress_milestones_streak_celebration
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to display a celebration modal when learner completes a configurable streak Supports staged rollout to students for a new micro-frontend-based implementation of the courseware page.

warning.paragraph: Also set settings.LEARNING_MICROFRONTEND_URL and COURSEWARE_MICROFRONTEND_PROGRESS_MILESTONES.

section.title: courseware.mfe_progress_milestones_streak_discount_enabled
section.paragraph: Desc: This flag enables an engagement discount incentive message.

warning.paragraph: This flag depends on the streak celebration feature being enabled

section.title: courseware.microfrontend_course_exit_page
section.paragraph: Desc: Supports staged rollout of the new micro-frontend-based implementation of the course exit page.

warning.paragraph: Also set settings.LEARNING_MICROFRONTEND_URL.

section.title: courseware.optimized_render_xblock
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag that determines whether we speed up the render_xblock for browsers by removing unnecessary JavaScript and CSS. It is possible that this could introduce edge cases with content that relies on these assets, so being a CourseWaffleFlag will give us the flexibility to exempt courses from these optimizations.

section.title: discounts.enable_discounting
section.paragraph: Desc: Toggle discounts always being disabled

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: discounts.enable_first_purchase_discount_override
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to enable the First Purchase Discount to be overridden from EDXWELCOME/BIENVENIDOAEDX 15% discount to a new code.

warning.paragraph: This feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: discussion.enable_captcha
section.paragraph: Desc: When the flag is ON, users will be able to see captcha for discussion

warning.paragraph: When the flag is ON, users will be able to see captcha for discussion.

section.title: discussions.enable_discussions_mfe
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to use the new MFE experience for discussions in the course tab

section.title: discussions.enable_new_structure_discussions
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to toggle on the new structure for in context discussions

section.title: discussions.enable_rate_limit
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to enable rate limit on discussions

section.title: discussions.only_verified_users_can_post
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to allow only verified users to post in discussions

section.title: discussions.override_discussion_legacy_settings
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to override visibility of discussion settings for legacy experience.

warning.paragraph: When the flag is ON, the discussion settings will be available on legacy experience.

section.title: discussions.pages_and_resources_mfe
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to enable new Pages and Resources experience for course.

warning.paragraph: When the flag is ON, the new experience for Pages and Resources will be enabled.

section.title: drag_and_drop_v2.grading_ignore_decoys
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables alternative grading for the xblock that does not include decoy items in the score.

section.title: edx_search.default_elastic_search
section.paragraph: Desc: This flag forces the use of ElasticSearch. It prevents errors from switching to OpenSearch before roll out.

section.title: edxval.override_existing_imported_transcripts
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables overriding existing transcripts when importing courses with already existing transcripts. The transcripts are compared using content hashing, and if the transcript being imported isn’t a duplicate, but different in content, it overrides the existing one. Otherwise, if the transcript is a duplicate, with same content, it doesn’t get uploaded.

section.title: effort_estimation.disabled
section.paragraph: Desc: If effort estimations are confusing for a given course (e.g. the course team has added manual estimates), you can turn them off case by case here.

section.title: enterprise.admin_portal_learner_profile_view_enabled
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables an admin to view a learner’s profile

section.title: enterprise.catalog_query_search_filters_enabled
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables filtering search results by catalog queries vs. enterprise-specific attributes.

section.title: enterprise.edit_highlights_enabled
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the Edit Highlights experience.

section.title: enterprise.enterprise_admin_onboarding
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the admin onboarding tour on the admin-portal.

section.title: enterprise.enterprise_customer_support_tool
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the enterprise customer support tool

section.title: enterprise.enterprise_learner_bff_enabled
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the enterprise learner BFF

section.title: experiments.add_dashboard_info
section.paragraph: Desc: Toggle for adding info about each course to the dashboard metadata

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: experiments.add_programs
section.paragraph: Desc: Toggle for adding the current course’s program information to user metadata

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: experiments.add_upsell_tracking
section.paragraph: Desc: Make sure upsell tracking JS works as expected.

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.
This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: export_course_metadata
section.paragraph: Desc: Export of course metadata (initially to s3 for use by braze)

section.title: forum_v2.enable_mysql_backend
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to use the MySQL backend instead of Mongo backend.

section.title: grades.bulk_management
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, bulk features are visible for management in masters course. As far as we understand, this feature is now unused and obsolete.

section.title: grades.disable_regrade_on_policy_change
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, a change in grading policy will not trigger re-grading.

section.title: grades.rejected_exam_overrides_grade
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, grades can no longer be updated 30 days after a course has ended. Note that this is only valid for courses which actually have an end date.

section.title: grades.writable_gradebook
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, add GET/POST endpoints for updating gradebook entries in bulk. Also, a link to the writable gradebook is added to the instructor dashboard.

warning.paragraph: Enabling this requires that the `WRITABLE_GRADEBOOK_URL` setting be properly defined.

section.title: instructor_task.use_on_disk_grade_reporting
section.paragraph: Desc: When generating grade reports, write chunks to disk to avoid out of memory errors.

section.title: learner_dashboard.enable_masters_program_tab_view
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to enable new Masters Program discussion experience for masters program. This flag is used to decide whether we need to render master program data in “tab” view or simple view. In the new tab view, we have tabs like “journey”, “live”, “discussions”

warning.paragraph: When the flag is ON, the new tabbed experience for Master Program Page will be enabled.

section.title: learner_dashboard.enable_program_tab_view
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to enable new Program discussion experience in tab view for course. This flag is used to decide whether we need to render program data in “tab” view or simple view. In the new tab view, we have tabs like “journey”, “live”, “discussions”

warning.paragraph: When the flag is ON, the new experience for Program discussions will be enabled.

section.title: learner_home_mfe.enabled
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to enable to redirect user to learner home mfe

section.title: legacy_studio.advanced_settings
section.paragraph: Desc: Temporarily fall back to the old Studio Advanced Settings page.

warning.paragraph: In Ulmo, this toggle will be removed. Only the new (React-based) experience will be available.

section.title: new_core_editors.use_video_gallery_flow
section.paragraph: Desc: This flag enables the use the video selection gallery on the flow of the new core video xblock editor

warning.paragraph: You need to activate the `new_core_editors.use_new_video_editor` flag to use this new flow.

section.title: notifications.enable_email_notifications
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to enable the Email Notifications feature

warning.paragraph: When the flag is ON, Email Notifications feature is enabled.

section.title: notifications.enable_notifications
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to enable the Notifications feature

warning.paragraph: When the flag is ON, Notifications feature is enabled.

section.title: notifications.enable_push_notifications
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to enable push Notifications feature on mobile devices

warning.paragraph: When the flag is ON, Notifications will go through ace push channels.

section.title: open_edx_util.display_maintenance_warning
section.paragraph: Desc: Displays the maintenance warning, when active.

section.title: require_course_email_auth
section.paragraph: Desc: If the flag is enabled, course-specific authorization is required, and the course_id is either not provided or not authorized, the feature is not available.

section.title: schedules.enable_debugging
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable debug level of logging for schedules messages.

section.title: send_to_submission_course.enable
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables use of the submissions service instead of legacy xqueue for course problem submissions.

section.title: settings.ALLOW_ADMIN_ENTERPRISE_COURSE_ENROLLMENT_DELETION
section.paragraph: Desc: If true, allows for the deletion of EnterpriseCourseEnrollment records via Django Admin.

section.title: settings.ALLOW_COURSE_RERUNS
section.paragraph: Desc: This will allow staff member to re-run the course from the studio home page and will always use the split modulestore. When this is set to False, the Re-run Course link will not be available on the studio home page.

section.title: settings.ALLOW_EMAIL_ADDRESS_CHANGE
section.paragraph: Desc: Allow users to change their email address on the Account Settings page. If this is disabled, users will not be able to change their email address.

section.title: settings.ALWAYS_REDIRECT_HOMEPAGE_TO_DASHBOARD_FOR_AUTHENTICATED_USER
section.paragraph: Desc: When a logged in user goes to the homepage (‘/’) the user will be redirected to the dashboard page when this flag is set to True - this is default Open edX behavior. Set to False to not redirect the user.

section.title: settings.AUTOMATIC_VERIFY_STUDENT_IDENTITY_FOR_TESTING
section.paragraph: Desc: If set to True, then we want to skip posting anything to Software Secure. Bypass posting anything to Software Secure if the auto verify feature for testing is enabled. We actually don’t even create the message because that would require encryption and message signing that rely on settings.VERIFY_STUDENT values that aren’t set in dev. So we just pretend like we successfully posted and automatically approve student identity verification attempts.

section.title: settings.BADGES_ENABLED
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable badges functionality.

section.title: settings.COURSES_ARE_BROWSABLE
section.paragraph: Desc: When this is set to True, all the courses will be listed on the /courses page and Explore Courses link will be visible. Set to False if courses list and Explore Courses link need to be hidden.

warning.paragraph: This Effects views and templates.

section.title: settings.CUSTOM_CERTIFICATE_TEMPLATES_ENABLED
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable custom certificate templates which are configured via Django admin.

section.title: settings.DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO
section.paragraph: Desc: Warn about removing support for deprecated course keys. To enable, set to True. To disable, set to False. To enable with a custom support deadline, set to an ISO-8601 date string: eg: ‘2020-09-01’

warning.paragraph: This can be removed once support is removed for deprecated course keys.

section.title: settings.DISABLE_ADVANCED_SETTINGS
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to `True` to disable the advanced settings page in Studio for all users except those having `is_superuser` or `is_staff` set to `True`.

section.title: settings.DISABLE_ALLOWED_ENROLLMENT_IF_ENROLLMENT_CLOSED
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to disable enrollment for user invited to a course

section.title: settings.DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION
section.paragraph: Desc: If set to True, it disables the course creation functionality and hides the “New Course” button in studio. It is important to note that the value of this flag only affects if the user doesn’t have a staff role, otherwise the course creation functionality will work as it should.

warning.paragraph: Another toggle DISABLE_LIBRARY_CREATION overrides DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION, if present.

section.title: settings.DISABLE_HONOR_CERTIFICATES
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to disable honor certificates. Typically used when your installation only allows verified certificates, like courses.edx.org.

section.title: settings.DISABLE_LOGIN_BUTTON
section.paragraph: Desc: Removes the display of the login button in the navigation bar. Change is only at the UI level. Used in systems where login is automatic, eg MIT SSL

section.title: settings.DISABLE_MOBILE_COURSE_AVAILABLE
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to remove Mobile Course Available UI Flag from Studio’s Advanced Settings page else Mobile Course Available UI Flag will be available on Studio side.

section.title: settings.DISPLAY_DEBUG_INFO_TO_STAFF
section.paragraph: Desc: Add a “Staff Debug” button to course blocks for debugging by course staff.

section.title: settings.DISPLAY_HISTOGRAMS_TO_STAFF
section.paragraph: Desc: This displays histograms in the Staff Debug Info panel to course staff.

warning.paragraph: Generating histograms requires scanning the courseware_studentmodule table on each view. This can make staff access to courseware very slow on large courses.

section.title: settings.EDITABLE_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
section.paragraph: Desc: This feature flag allows editing of short descriptions on the Schedule & Details page in Open edX Studio. Set to False if you want to disable the editing of the course short description.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_ACCOUNT_DELETION
section.paragraph: Desc: Whether to display the account deletion section on Account Settings page. Set to False to hide this section.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_AUTHN_MICROFRONTEND
section.paragraph: Desc: Supports staged rollout of a new micro-frontend-based implementation of the logistration.

warning.paragraph: Also set settings.AUTHN_MICROFRONTEND_URL for rollout. This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_BULK_ENROLLMENT_VIEW
section.paragraph: Desc: When set to True the bulk enrollment view is enabled and one can use it to enroll multiple users in a course using bulk enrollment API endpoint (/api/bulk_enroll/v1/bulk_enroll).

section.title: settings.ENABLE_BULK_USER_RETIREMENT
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to enable bulk user retirement through REST API. This is disabled by default.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_CATALOG_MICROFRONTEND
section.paragraph: Desc: Supports staged rollout of a new micro-frontend-based implementation of the catalog.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_CERTIFICATES_IDV_REQUIREMENT
section.paragraph: Desc: Whether to enforce ID Verification requirements for course certificates generation

section.title: settings.ENABLE_COMBINED_LOGIN_REGISTRATION_FOOTER
section.paragraph: Desc: Display the standard footer in the login page. This feature can be overridden by a site- specific configuration.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES_LTI_TOOL
section.paragraph: Desc: When set to True, Content Libraries in Studio can be used as an LTI 1.3 tool by external LTI platforms.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_COOKIE_CONSENT
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable header banner for cookie consent using this service: https://cookieconsent.insites.com/

section.title: settings.ENABLE_COSMETIC_DISPLAY_PRICE
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable the display of “cosmetic_display_price”, set in a course advanced settings. This cosmetic price is used when there is no registration price associated to the course.

warning.paragraph: The use case of this feature toggle is uncertain.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, this adds a Search the course widget on the course outline and courseware pages for searching courseware data.

warning.paragraph: In order to get this working, your courses data should be indexed in Elasticsearch. You will see the search widget on the courseware page only if the DISABLE_COURSE_OUTLINE_PAGE_FLAG is set.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_FOR_COURSE_STAFF
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, this adds a Search the course widget on the course outline and courseware pages for searching courseware data but for course staff users only.

warning.paragraph: In order to get this working, your courses data should be indexed in Elasticsearch. If ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH is enabled then the search widget will be visible to all learners and this flag’s value does not matter in that case. This flag is enabled in devstack by default.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_VERIFIED_REQUIRED
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, the courseware search feature will only be enabled for users in a verified enrollment track.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_COURSE_ASSESSMENT_GRADE_CHANGE_SIGNAL
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to start sending signals for assessment level grade updates. Notably, the only handler of this signal at the time of this writing sends assessment updates to enterprise integrated channels.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_COURSE_DISCOVERY
section.paragraph: Desc: Add a course search widget to the LMS for searching courses. When this is enabled, the latest courses are no longer displayed on the LMS landing page. Also, an “Explore Courses” item is added to the navbar.

warning.paragraph: The COURSE_DISCOVERY_MEANINGS setting should be properly defined.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_COURSE_FILENAME_CCX_SUFFIX
section.paragraph: Desc: If set to True, CCX ID will be included in the generated filename for CCX courses.

warning.paragraph: Turning this feature ON will affect all generated filenames which are related to CCX courses.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_COURSE_HOME_REDIRECT
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, along with the ENABLE_MKTG_SITE feature toggle, users who attempt to access a course “about” page will be redirected to the course home url.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_COURSE_SORTING_BY_START_DATE
section.paragraph: Desc: When a user goes to the homepage (‘/’) the user sees the courses listed in the announcement dates order - this is default Open edX behavior. Set to True to change the course sorting behavior by their start dates, latest first.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_CREDIT_ELIGIBILITY
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, it is possible to define a credit eligibility criteria in the CMS. A “Credit Eligibility” section then appears for those courses in the LMS.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_DASHBOARD_SEARCH
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, this adds a Search Your Courses widget on the dashboard page for searching courseware data.

warning.paragraph: In order to get this working, your courses data should be indexed in Elasticsearch.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST
section.paragraph: Desc: Set this to True if you want the discussion digest emails enabled automatically for new users. This will be set on all new account registrations.

warning.paragraph: It is not recommended to enable this feature if ENABLE_DISCUSSION_HOME_PANEL is not enabled, since subscribers who receive digests in that case will only be able to unsubscribe via links embedded in their emails, and they will have no way to resubscribe.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_HOME_PANEL
section.paragraph: Desc: Hides or displays a welcome panel under the Discussion tab, which includes a subscription on/off setting for discussion digest emails.

warning.paragraph: This should remain off in production until digest notifications are online.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_DJANGO_ADMIN_SITE
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to False if you want to disable Django’s admin site.

warning.paragraph: It is not recommended to disable this feature as there are many settings available on

section.title: settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES
section.paragraph: Desc: This toggle enables the students to save and manage their annotations in the course using the notes service. The bulk of the actual work in storing the notes is done by a separate service (see the edx-notes-api repo).

warning.paragraph: Requires the edx-notes-api service properly running and to have configured the django settings EDXNOTES_INTERNAL_API and EDXNOTES_PUBLIC_API. If you update this setting, also update it in Studio.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_FOOTER_MOBILE_APP_LINKS
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True if you want show the mobile app links (Apple App Store & Google Play Store) in the footer.

warning.paragraph: If you set this to True then you should also set your mobile application’s app store and play store URLs in the MOBILE_STORE_URLS settings dictionary. These links are not part of the default theme. If you want these links on your footer then you should use the edx.org theme.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_HIDE_FROM_TOC_UI
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, exposes hide_from_toc xblock attribute so course authors can configure it as

section.title: settings.ENABLE_HTML_XBLOCK_STUDENT_VIEW_DATA
section.paragraph: Desc: Whether HTML Block returns HTML content with the Course Blocks API when the API is called with student_view_data=html query parameter.

warning.paragraph: Because the Course Blocks API caches its data, the cache must be cleared (e.g. by re-publishing the course) for changes to this flag to take effect.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_LOGIN_MICROFRONTEND
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable the login micro frontend.

warning.paragraph: The login MFE domain name should be listed in LOGIN_REDIRECT_WHITELIST.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_LTI_PII_ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables the lti pii acknowledgement feature for a course

section.title: settings.ENABLE_LTI_PROVIDER
section.paragraph: Desc: When set to True, Open edX site can be used as an LTI Provider to other systems and applications.

warning.paragraph: After enabling this feature flag there are multiple steps involved to configure edX as LTI provider. Full guide is available here: https://docs.openedx.org/en/latest/site_ops/install_configure_run_guide/configuration/lti/index.html

section.title: settings.ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS
section.paragraph: Desc: This feature will keep track of the number of failed login attempts on a given user’s email. If the number of consecutive failed login attempts - without a successful login at some point - reaches a configurable threshold (default 6), then the account will be locked for a configurable amount of seconds (30 minutes) which will prevent additional login attempts until this time period has passed. If a user successfully logs in, all the counter which tracks the number of failed attempts will be reset back to 0. If set to False then account locking will be disabled for failed login attempts.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_NEW_BULK_EMAIL_EXPERIENCE
section.paragraph: Desc: When true, replaces the bulk email tool found on the instructor dashboard with a link to the new communications MFE version instead. Setting the tool to false will leave the old bulk email tool experience in place.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_ORA_USERNAMES_ON_DATA_EXPORT
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to True to add deanonymized usernames to ORA data report.

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_SEND_XBLOCK_LIFECYCLE_EVENTS_OVER_BUS
section.paragraph: Desc: Enables sending xblock lifecycle events over the event bus. Used to create the EVENT_BUS_PRODUCER_CONFIG setting

warning.paragraph: The default may be changed in a later release. See https://github.com/openedx/openedx-events/issues/265

section.title: settings.ENABLE_SPECIAL_EXAMS
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable to use special exams, aka timed and proctored exams.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_STUDENT_HISTORY_VIEW
section.paragraph: Desc: This provides a UI to show a student’s submission history in a problem by the Staff Debug tool. Set to False if you want to hide Submission History from the courseware page.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_AUTH
section.paragraph: Desc: Turn on third-party auth. Disabled for now because full implementations are not yet available. Remember to run migrations if you enable this; we don’t create tables by default. This feature can be enabled on a per-site basis. When enabling this feature, remember to define the allowed authentication backends with the AUTHENTICATION_BACKENDS setting.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_UNICODE_USERNAME
section.paragraph: Desc: Set this to True to allow unicode characters in username. Enabling this will also automatically enable SOCIAL_AUTH_CLEAN_USERNAMES. When this is enabled, usernames will have to match the regular expression defined by USERNAME_REGEX_PARTIAL.

section.title: settings.ENABLE_XBLOCK_VIEW_ENDPOINT
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable an API endpoint, named “xblock_view”, to serve rendered XBlock views. This might be used by external applications. See for instance jquery-xblock (now unmaintained): https://github.com/openedx/jquery-xblock

section.title: settings.HIDE_DASHBOARD_COURSES_UNTIL_ACTIVATED
section.paragraph: Desc: When set, it hides the Courses list on the Learner Dashboard page if the learner has not yet activated the account and not enrolled in any courses.

section.title: settings.IN_CONTEXT_DISCUSSION_ENABLED_DEFAULT
section.paragraph: Desc: Set to False to disable in-context discussion for units by default.

section.title: settings.SEND_LEARNING_CERTIFICATE_LIFECYCLE_EVENTS_TO_BUS
section.paragraph: Desc: When True, the system will publish certificate lifecycle signals to the event bus. This toggle is used to create the EVENT_BUS_PRODUCER_CONFIG setting.

warning.paragraph: The default may be changed in a later release. See https://github.com/openedx/openedx-events/issues/265

section.title: settings.SKIP_EMAIL_VALIDATION
section.paragraph: Desc: Turn this on to skip sending emails for user validation. Beware, as this leaves the door open to potential spam abuse.

warning.paragraph: The login MFE domain name should be listed in LOGIN_REDIRECT_WHITELIST.

section.title: student.courseenrollment_admin
section.paragraph: Desc: This toggle will enable the rendering of the admin view of the CourseEnrollment model.

warning.paragraph: Enabling this toggle may cause performance problems. The CourseEnrollment admin view makes DB queries that could cause site outages for a large enough Open edX installation.

section.title: student.enable_enrollment_confirmation_email
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable course enrollment email template

section.title: student.redirect_to_courseware_after_enrollment
section.paragraph: Desc: Redirect to courseware after enrollment instead of dashboard.

section.title: studio.custom_relative_dates
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to enable custom pacing input for Personalized Learner Schedule (PLS).

warning.paragraph: Flag course_experience.relative_dates should also be active for relative dates functionalities to work.

section.title: teams.content_groups_for_teams
section.paragraph: Desc: This flag enables content groups for teams. Content groups are virtual groupings of learners who will see a particular set of course content. When this flag is enabled, course authors can create teams and assign content to each of them. Then, when a learner joins a team, they will see the content that is assigned to that team’s content group. This flag is only relevant for courses that have teams enabled.

section.title: teams.enable_teams_app
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag to enable teams app for a course

warning.paragraph: When the flag is ON, the teams app will be visible in the new course authoring mfe.

section.title: third_party_auth.apple_user_migration
section.paragraph: Desc: Enable User ID matching while apple migration is in process

warning.paragraph: None.

section.title: user_authn.enable_login_using_thirdparty_auth_only
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, users must be sign in using their allowed domain SSO account. This includes sign- ins to the Django admin dashboard at “/admin”.

warning.paragraph: Requires THIRD_PARTY_AUTH_ONLY_DOMAIN to also be set.

section.title: user_authn.enable_pwned_password_api
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, user password’s vulnerability would be checked via pwned password database

section.title: user_tours.tours_disabled
section.paragraph: Desc: This flag disables user tours in LMS.

section.title: verify_student.optimised_is_small_course
section.paragraph: Desc: Supports staged rollout to improved is_small_course method.

warning.paragraph: Description mentions staged rollout, but the use case is not set as temporary. This may actually be a temporary toggle.

section.title: verify_student.use_new_email_templates
section.paragraph: Desc: Supports staged rollout to students for a new email templates implementation for ID verification.

warning.paragraph: This temporary feature toggle does not have a target removal date.

section.title: video_config.public_video_share
section.paragraph: Desc: Gates access to the public social sharing video feature.

section.title: video_config.transcript_feedback
section.paragraph: Desc: Gates access to the transcript feedback widget feature.

section.title: video_config.xpert_translations_ui
section.paragraph: Desc: Gates access to the Xpert Translations UI feature.

section.title: videos.deprecate_youtube
section.paragraph: Desc: Waffle flag telling whether youtube is deprecated. When enabled, videos are no longer uploaded to YouTube as part of the video pipeline.

section.title: videos.enable_devstack_video_uploads
section.paragraph: Desc: When enabled, use Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for authenticating to AWS. These short- lived access tokens are well suited for development (probably?). [At the time of annotation, the exact consequences of enabling this feature toggle are uncertain.]

warning.paragraph: Enabling this feature requires that the ROLE_ARN, MFA_SERIAL_NUMBER, MFA_TOKEN settings are properly defined.
